t: Unilever to sell Elida Beauty to Yellow Wood Partners | Unilever
s: October 25, 2024 - Unilever announces it has received a binding offer from Yellow Wood Partners LLC to acquire Elida Beauty. Read more here.

t: Unilever confirms sale of Elida Beauty’s iconic brands to focus on “core strategic growth priorities”
s: December 18, 2023 - Unilever confirms it will offload its Elida Beauty division after receiving a binding offer from private equity firm Yellow Wood Partners.

t: Yellow Wood Partners Announces Acquisition of Elida Beauty from Unilever
s: December 18, 2023 - BOSTON, Dec. 18, 2023 /PRNewswire/ -- Yellow Wood Partners LLC ("Yellow Wood"), a Boston-based private equity firm focused on investing in consumer brands and companies, today announced a binding offer to acquire Elida Beauty, a portfolio of brands from Unilever (NYSE: UL).

t: Unilever to sell Q-Tips maker Elida Beauty to Yellow Wood | Reuters
s: December 18, 2023 - Consumer goods giant Unilever on Monday said it would sell Elida Beauty, its non-core beauty and personal care division, to U.S. private equity firm Yellow Wood Partners.

November 26, 2024 - Amazon offers multiple lines of privately labeled products. These are available on Amazon.com, Amazon Fresh, Prime Pantry, Prime Now, Amazon Go, and Whole Foods Market. Amazon houses its in-house brand offerings under the “Our Brands” label, which is separate from exclusive brands.

t: Yellow Wood Partners Completes Acquisition of Elida Beauty from Unilever
s: June 6, 2024 - BOSTON, June 6, 2024 /PRNewswire/ -- Yellow Wood Partners LLC ("Yellow Wood"), a Boston-based private equity firm focused on investing in consumer brands and companies, today announced that it has completed the acquisition of Elida Beauty brands from Unilever (NYSE: UL).

t: Unilever to sell Elida Beauty business to Yellow Wood Partners - Premium Beauty News
s: December 22, 2023 - The Unilever group has concluded an agreement to sell its Elida Beauty business – a portfolio of brands including Q-tips, Impulse, Caress, Tigi, Timotei, Monsavon, Brut, Moussel, Alberto Balsam, and VO5 – to Boston-based private equity firm Yellow Wood Partners.
